title: Evaluate and Upload Data
text: evaluation report summary provides quick look data package evaluation results. Specifically, total number checks run many checks resulted statuses “valid”, “info”, “warn”, “error”. meaning status messages: Valid - result quality check matches expectation. Info - result quality check may may match expectation, since expectation required, information returned instead Warn Error. Warn - result quality check match expectation. match explicitly required publish data package, strongly recommended. Error - result quality check match expectation. match required data package can published. evaluation check results warning error status resolved moving ahead (note errors must corrected). Resolve problems data metadata repeat evaluation process errors (preferably warnings) resolved.
code: # Summarize report read_evaluate_report_summary(transaction, env = "staging") #> =================================================== #>   EVALUATION REPORT #> =================================================== #> #> PackageId: edi.595.1 #> Report Date/Time: 2021-12-16T22:49:25 #> Total Quality Checks: 29 #> Valid: 21 #> Info: 8 #> Warn: 0 #> Error: 0

title: Evaluate and Upload Data
text: full evaluation report provides detailed information check diagnostics help resolve issues. full report can printed console written file plain text html viewed web browser (recommended). See ?read_evaluate_report details. Evaluation Report broken multiple parts, always starting Dataset Report, followed Entity Report entity (data object/file) included data package. differentiated header lines Entity Name Identifier. Dataset Entity Reports share layout: # - number quality check Identifier - identifier quality check Status - status result quality check Quality Check - Describes type quality check (data, metadata, congruency), system (knb, lter), status results failure Name - name quality check Description - Brief description quality check Expected - result quality check expecting Found - actual result quality check Explanation - Additional information describing rationale quality check Suggestion - Potential data package improvements implement pass quality check Reference - Source rationale quality check find information Parse document address errors warnings (denoted Error Warn labels). understand quality check failed, first read Name Description quality check determine tested test conducted. , compare Expected result Found. still clear caused failure, try gain additional insight Explanation, Suggestion, Reference fields, contact EDI Data Curation Team clarification (info@edirepository.org).
code: # Read the evaluation report report <- read_evaluate_report(transaction, as = "char", env = "staging") message(report) #> =================================================== #>   EVALUATION REPORT #> =================================================== #>    #> PackageId: edi.595.1 #> Report Date/Time: 2021-12-16T08:17:40 #> Total Quality Checks: 29 #> Valid: 21 #> Info: 8 #> Warn: 0 #> Error: 0 #>  #> --------------------------------------------------- #>   DATASET REPORT #> --------------------------------------------------- #>    #> IDENTIFIER: packageIdPattern #> NAME: packageId pattern matches "scope.identifier.revision" #> DESCRIPTION: Check against LTER requirements for scope.identifier.revision #> EXPECTED: 'scope.n.m', where 'n' and 'm' are integers and 'scope' is one ... #> FOUND: edi.595.1 #> STATUS: valid #> EXPLANATION:  #> SUGGESTION:  #> REFERENCE:  #>  #> IDENTIFIER: emlVersion #> NAME: EML version 2.1.0 or beyond #> DESCRIPTION: Check the EML document declaration for version 2.1.0 or higher #> EXPECTED: eml://ecoinformatics.org/eml-2.1.0 or higher #> FOUND: https://eml.ecoinformatics.org/eml-2.2.0 #> STATUS: valid #> EXPLANATION: Validity of this quality report is dependent on this check ... #> SUGGESTION:  #> REFERENCE:  #> ...

what: Get the Journal Citation Report for Specific Data Packages
title: Retrieve Citation Metrics
text: Get identifiers certain scope. Get latest revisions identifier retrieve journal citations. citation information returned data frame. First set empty data frame append records . Various analyses may now conducted data frame. E.g., number articles citing data packages number articles citing data packages
code: scope <- "edi" identifiers <- list_data_package_identifiers(scope) identifiers <- paste0(scope, ".", identifiers, ".1") res <- lapply(identifiers, list_data_package_citations, list_all = TRUE) df_return_all <- do.call(rbind, res) df_data_packages <- df_return_all %>%   separate(     packageId,     into = c("scope", "datasetNum", "revision"),     sep = "\\."   ) %>%   mutate(datasetId = paste(scope, datasetNum, sep = ".")) %>%   distinct(datasetId)  print(paste("Unique data packages being cited:", nrow(df_data_packages))) #> [1] "Unique data packages being cited: 375" df_articles <- df_return_all %>%  distinct(articleUrl) print(paste('Number of aricles:', nrow(df_articles))) #> [1] "Number of aricles: 503"

what: Get the Audit Report for Downloaded Data Entities
title: Retrieve Download Metrics
text: Accessing audit report requires authentication. Setting query parameters get desired audit report: category ‘info’ see actual downloads users bots serviceMethod readDataEntity, .e., downloads data entities resourceID substring full URL pattern https://pasta.lternet.edu/package/data/eml/{scope}/{identifier}/{version}. example use scope get download records LTER site. fromTime (ISO format) important set limit number records processed. Reliable download information bot access filtered available since 2019. toTime (ISO time format) may set well limit may used limit number records information searchable fields see get_audit_report() documentation. Filter records parse entityID scope, identifier, version. robot DataONE downloads records filtered . Group count downloads data package entire time period. Graph 20 downloaded data packages. Plot downloads identifier Count downloads per month. graph daily downloads. Plot daily downloads
code: login() #> userID: "my_name" #> userPass: "my_secret" # Construct the query query <- paste(   "category=info",   "serviceMethod=readDataEntity",   "resourceId=knb-lter-ntl",   "fromTime=2018-12-12T00:00:00",   "toTime=2022-05-24T00:00:00",   sep = "&" )  # Get the report df_report <- get_audit_report(query)  logout() df_results <- df_report %>%   filter(user != "robot") %>%   filter(userAgent != "DataONE-Python/3.4.7 +http://dataone.org/") %>%   filter(nchar(resourceId) > 0) %>%   separate(entryTime, into = c("date", NA), sep = "T") %>%   separate(     resourceId,      into = c(NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, "scope", "identifier", "revision", NA),      sep = "/"   )  df_results$date <- ymd(df_results$date) df_downloads <- df_results %>%   group_by(identifier) %>%   summarise(n = n()) top20 <- arrange(df_downloads, desc(n)) %>% slice(1:20)  ggplot(top20, aes(x = reorder(identifier, -n), y = n)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   labs(     y = "Number of Downloads",     x = "Data Package Identifier",     title = "Downloads by Identifier"   ) df_downloads_per_month <- df_results %>%   mutate(month = month(date)) %>%    group_by(month) %>%   summarise(n = n()) df_downloads_daily <- df_results %>%   group_by(date) %>%   arrange(date) %>%   summarise(n = n())  ggplot(df_downloads_daily, aes(x = date, y = n, group = 1)) +   geom_line() +   labs(     y = "Number of Downloaded Entities",     x = "Date",     title = "Daily Downloads"   )

title: Search and Access Data
text: repository search service standard deployment Apache Solr indexes select metadata fields data packages. possible motivations using search API include: Building custom search interface offers feature found EDI data portal (e.g. build query interface search results always restricted particular research project). Building local data catalog. case constructing query program displaying table matching documents local site including things like title, authors, keywords, perhaps abstract. Mining data EML metadata data mined, processed, analyzed way. Increased efficiency using search API often faster relying data portal results displayed HTML paged 10 documents time. list searchable fields see search_data_packages(). constructing Solr queries see Apache Solr Wiki. browser based search experience use EDI data portal. Results can filtered include fields interest. constructing query note 15403 data packages ecotrends project 10492 data packages LTER Landsat project, can excluded returned results including &fq=-scope:(ecotrends+lter-landsat) query string. Use wild cards operators match anything control number returned results. Use scope, keyword, author fields get data packages belonging research site, organization, author. Queries can complex. alternative method searching retrieving metadata “list read” method. involves listing data package identifiers interest, read corresponding metadata data packages one time, parsing extracting whatever metadata ’re interested searching additional processing . Although sounds like work using search API, fact generally , use cases might preferred approach. example list read method allows access previous versions data package, whereas search API provides access recent version, method provides access EML content, just indexed fields.
code: # Match all documents with keywords "disturbance" and return only their IDs res <- search_data_packages(query = 'q=keyword:disturbance&fl=id') # Match all documents with keywords "disturbance", excluding ecotrends and  # lter-landsat scopes from the returned results query <- 'q=keyword:disturbance&fl=packageid&fq=-scope:(ecotrends+lter-landsat)' res <- search_data_packages(query) # Match anything, display all fields, limit to only one document res <- search_data_packages(query = 'q=*&fl=*&rows=1') # Find all FCE LTER data packages, displaying the package id, title, and DOI query <- 'q=scope:knb-lter-fce&fl=packageid,title,doi&rows=100' res <- search_data_packages(query)  # Query on author query <- 'q=author:duane+costa&fq=author:costa&fl=id,title,author,score' res <- search_data_packages(query) # Query on subject "Primary Production" OR subject "plant". Note that 'subject' # is an aggregation of several other fields containing searchable text:  # 'author', 'organization', 'title', 'keyword', and 'abstract' fields rolled # together into a single searchable field. query <- paste0('q=subject:("Primary+Production")+OR+subject:plant&fq=',                 '-scope:ecotrends&fq=-scope:lter-landsat*&fl=id,packageid,',                 'title,author,organization,pubdate,coordinates') res <- search_data_packages(query)

title: Search and Access Data
text: EDI data repository provides open access archived data packages. Packages can downloaded .zip format individual data entities downloaded raw bytes files. Entities common format can parsed simply readers complex formats need metadata help parsing. Sometimes, ’s valuable work latest version within series data packages ensure current data application. determine newest data package identifier, can utilize ‘newest’ filter provided list_data_package_revisions() function append returned value ‘scope’ ‘identifier’ parameters. However, important considerations working newest version. instance, ‘entityId’ (identifiers individual data objects) can change data entity evolves, making unsuitable referencing newest data entity. One workaround use ‘entityName’, may remain stable across versions, although isn’t always guaranteed. Additionally, aware alterations data entity structure, changes data table column names, can potentially disrupt processes. cases, robust messaging error handling can prove invaluable workflows rely data. purposes vignette, use ‘edi.1047.1’ example. Downloading data package archive (.zip) requires data package ID. Downloading individual data entity requires entity ID. Common formats easily parsed. Less common formats require metadata parsing. metadata listed “physical” node data entities EML. See emld library working EML list JSON-LD. See xml2 library working EML XML.
code: scope = "edi" identifier = "1047" revision = list_data_package_revisions(scope, identifier, filter = "newest") paste(scope, identifier, revision, sep = ".") #> [1] "edi.1047.2" packageId <- "edi.1047.1" # Download data package to path read_data_package_archive(packageId, path = tempdir()) #> |=============================================================| 100% dir(tempdir()) #> [1] ""edi.1047.1.zip" # List data entities of the data package res <- read_data_entity_names(packageId) res #>                           entityId                entityName #> 1 3abac5f99ecc1585879178a355176f6d        Environmentals.csv #> 2 f6bfa89b48ced8292840e53567cbf0c8               ByCatch.csv #> 3 c75642ddccb4301327b4b1a86bdee906               Chinook.csv #> 4 2c9ee86cc3f3ffc729c5f18bfe0a2a1d             Steelhead.csv #> 5 785690848dd20f4910637250cdc96819 TrapEfficiencyRelease.csv #> 6 58b9000439a5671ea7fe13212e889ba5 TrapEfficiencySummary.csv #> 7 86e61c1a501b7dcf0040d10e009bfd87        TrapOperations.csv  # Download Steelhead.csv in raw bytes. Use the entityName and entityID as keys. entityName <- "Steelhead.csv" entityId <- res$entityId[res$entityName == entityName] raw <- read_data_entity(packageId, entityId) head(raw) #> [1] ef bb bf 44 61 74 # These data have a common format are simply parsed data <- readr::read_csv(file = raw) data #> # A tibble: 2,926 x 14 #>    Date   trapVisitID subSiteName catchRawID releaseID commonName  #>    <chr>        <dbl> <chr>            <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>       #>  1 1/12/~         326 North Chan~      32123         0 Steelhead ~ #>  2 1/14/~         336 North Chan~      33980         0 Steelhead ~ #>  3 1/15/~         337 North Chan~      32683         0 Steelhead ~ #>  4 1/16/~         339 North Chan~      32971         0 Steelhead ~ #>  5 1/17/~         341 North Chan~      33104         0 Steelhead ~ #>  6 1/18/~         342 North Chan~      33304         0 Steelhead ~ #>  7 1/19/~         343 North Chan~      33432         0 Steelhead ~ #>  8 1/21/~         349 North Chan~      34083         0 Steelhead ~ #>  9 1/21/~         349 North Chan~      34084         0 Steelhead ~ #> 10 1/23/~         351 North Chan~      34384         0 Steelhead ~ #> # title: Tests Requiring Authentication
text: first line test requiring authentication include skip_if_logged_out(). internal use function located R/utilities.R. Tests including line skipped unless R environment variable EDI_TOKEN set. Use login() set variable. Example:
code: context("Create journal citation")  testthat::test_that("Test attributes of returned object", {   skip_if_logged_out()   journalCitationId <- create_journal_citation(     packageId = get_test_package(),      articleDoi = "10.1890/11-1026.1",     articleUrl = "https://doi.org/10.1890/11-1026.1",     articleTitle = "Corridors promote fire via connectivity and edge effects",     journalTitle = "Ecological Applications",     relationType = "IsCitedBy",     env = "staging")   expect_type(journalCitationId, "double")   res <- delete_journal_citation(journalCitationId, env = "staging")   expect_true(res) })

what: Requiring Data Package Evaluation or Upload
title: Tests Requiring Authentication
text: evaluation upload data package required test, include second line skip_if_missing_eml_config(). Tests including line skipped unless R environment variables EDI_USERID EDI_TEST_URL set. Use config_test_eml() set variables. set minimal test data package: Copy test data object inst/extdata/data.txt web accessible location. EDI repository download data object ’s URL. URL present redirects else EDI repository access. Add create_test_eml() create EML metadata file within context test. Data packages require unique identifiers often change test test. Example:
code: context("Evaluate data package")  testthat::test_that("Test attributes of returned object", {   skip_if_logged_out()   skip_if_missing_eml_config()   # Create data package for evaluation   identifier <- create_reservation(scope = "edi", env = "staging")   packageId <- paste0("edi.", identifier, ".1")   eml <- create_test_eml(path = tempdir(), packageId = packageId)   on.exit(file.remove(eml), add = TRUE, after = FALSE)   # Evaluate   transaction <- evaluate_data_package(eml, env = "staging")   res <- check_status_evaluate(transaction, env = "staging")   expect_true(res)   # Read evaluation report   report <- read_evaluate_report(transaction, env = "staging")   expect_true("xml_document" %in% class(report))   delete_reservation("edi", identifier, env = "staging") })

title: Evaluate data package — evaluate_data_package
text: data entity described eml must accompanied web accessible URL EML XPath ".//physical/distribution/online/url". EDI data repository downloads data entities via URL. URLs must static redirects otherwise data entities downloaded. optional query parameter, "useChecksum", can appended URL. specified, useChecksum query parameter directs repository determine whether can use existing copy data entity previous revision data package based matching metadata-documented checksum value (MD5 SHA-1) checksum existing copy. match found, repository skip upload data entity remote URL instead use matching copy. Specifying "useChecksum" can save time eliminating data uploads, clients take care ensure metadata-documented checksum values accurate date.

title: Get audit count — get_audit_count
text: (numeric) Returns count number audit records matching query parameters specified request.

title: Get audit count — get_audit_count
text: Query parameters specified key=value pairs, multiple pairs must delimited ampersands (&), single value specified particular key. following query parameter keys allowed: category - Can : debug, info, error, warn service - EDI data repository services serviceMethod - EDI data repository service Resource   class JAX-RS methods user - user group - group authSystem - valid auth system identifier status - valid HTTP Response Code resourceId - EDI data repository resource identifier, e.g.   https://pasta.lternet.edu/package/eml/knb-lter-/2719/6, substring    thereof (see details ) fromTime - ISO8601 timestamp toTime - ISO8601 timestamp limit - positive whole number query parameters fromTime optionally toTime used indicate time span. toTime absent, count include matching records current time. Either parameters may used . query parameter limit sets upper limit number audit records returned. example, "limit=1000". query parameter resourceId match audit log entry whose resourceId value contains specified string value. Thus, query parameter "resourceId=knb-lter-" match audit log entry whose resourceId value contains substring "knb-lter-", query parameter "resourceId=knb-lter-/2719/6" match audit log entry whose resourceId value contains substring "knb-lter-/2719/6".

title: Login to the EDI repository — login
text: userId, userPass, config NULL, console prompt credentials. config: Supplying credentials file named config.txt facilitates authentication within automated/unassisted processes. Contents file new line separated form "<argument> = <value>" (e.g. userId = myname).

title: Login to the EDI repository — login
text: works authenticating EDI credentials. work authenticating ORCiD, GitHub, Google credentials. careful accidentally share userId userPass. tips avoid : write code explicitly lists credentials. save workspace exiting R session. store credentials environmental variables reference   . use config using version control ensure   config.txt file listed .gitignore. may shared credentials, please reset password https://dashboard.edirepository.org/dashboard/auth/reset_password_init.

title: Read data package citation — read_data_package_citation
text: citation may consist list authors, publication year,  title, data package version, publisher, digital object identifier,  access date. order presence components depends  style requested citation (see query parameters ). brief discussion fields citation: Authors - function uses content extracted science    metadata described Ecological Metadata Language (EML) document    generate author list. Specifically, uses creator section EML    generate list authors, including individuals, organizations,    positions. function preserves order creator list defined within    EML document. , like citation begin    organization name, position creator element describes    organization beginning creator list EML document. function also assumes creator element contains information    pertaining single "creator", although EML allows multiple    identities single creator element. best    accommodate multi-named subjects within creator element, mileage    vary. function opinionated determines author: individuals,    take precedence organizations positions, organizations take    precedence positions. means individual    organization position defined single creator element,    function sets author named information within    individual element; , organization position exist within    single creator element, function set author named    information within organization element. Finally, position    defined within single creator element, function set    author named information within position element.    important note function respects creator content    defined EML document set position name author    present meets hierarchy. believe    position displayed data package author,    include data package creator. Finally, function collect use tertiary information (e.g.,    phone number, addresses, emails) within creator element since    type information used part data package citation. Publication Year - publication year defined calendar    year data package archived EDI data repository.    publication year may differ year publication date entered    EML, often set date data package became    publicly available, although yet archived EDI data    repository. Title - function uses title section EML citation    title. EML title elements copied verbatim citation. Version Number - citation version number represents revision    step (increment) data package archived EDI data    repository. Revision values whole numbers one--one    correspondence revision data package repository. Publisher - default, publisher field citation    permanently set "Environmental Data Initiative". value    change tenure EDI data repository. DOI - Digital Object Identifier (DOI) EDI generated DOI    value registered DataCite, displayed using fully    qualified "doi.org" URL. DOI URL resolve corresponding    "landing page" data package displayed EDI Data Portal. Access Date - access date UTC date citation    requested.

title: Search data packages — search_data_packages
text: Searches data packages EDI data repository using specified Solr query.

title: Search data packages — search_data_packages
text: query (character) Query (see details ) (character) Format returned object. Can : "data.frame"  "xml". env (character) Repository environment. Can : "production", "staging", "development".

title: Search data packages — search_data_packages
text: (data.frame xml_document) Search results containing fields: abstract begindate doi enddate funding geographicdescription id methods packageid pubdate responsibleParties scope site taxonomic title authors spatialCoverage sources keywords organizations singledates timescales

title: Search data packages — search_data_packages
text: Documents EDI data repository Solr index can discovered based metadata values stored following list searchable fields (EML content queryable): Single-value fields: abstract begindate - ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss) doi enddate - ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss) funding geographicdescription id methods packageid - Data Id "scope.identifier.revision" format pubdate - ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss) responsibleParties scope singledate site taxonomic title Multi-value fields: author coordinates - Use "IsWithin(West+East+North+South)"    cardinal direction decimal degrees South equator   negative East prime meridian positive. keyword organization projectTitle relatedProjectTitle timescale query parser: optimal query parser (defType=edismax) added every query. See Apache Solr Wiki construct Solr query.

title: Search data packages — search_data_packages
text: newest version data packages searchable, older versions . constructing query note 15403 data packages ecotrends project 10492 data packages LTER Landsat project, can excluded returned results including &fq=-scope:(ecotrends+lter-landsat) query string.

title: Search data packages — search_data_packages
code: if (FALSE) {  # Search for data packages containing the term "air temperature" res <- search_data_packages(query = 'q="air+temperature"&fl=*')  # Search for data packages containing the term "air temperature" and # returning only the packageid, title, and score of each match res <- search_data_packages(query = 'q="air+temperature"&fl=packageid,title,score')  # Search for data packages containing the term "air temperature", returning # only the packageid, title, score, and excluding ecotrends and lter-landsat # scopes from the returned results query <- paste0('q="air+temperature"&fl=packageid,title,score&',                 'fq=-scope:(ecotrends+lter-landsat)') res <- search_data_packages(query) }
